level.heading: Breaking and entering vending machines and similar devices.
level.text: Whoever in the District of Columbia breaks open, opens, or enters, without right, any parking meter, coin telephone, vending machine dispensing goods or services, money changer, or any other device designed to receive currency, with intent to carry away any part of such device or anything contained therein, shall be sentenced to a term of imprisonment of not more than 3 years or to a fine of not more than $3,000, or both.

level.heading: CREDIT(S)
level.text: (July 29, 1970, 84 Stat. 600, Pub. L. 91-358, title II, ยง 203.)
